Psionics: Psionics a new Intelligence based skill that serves to understand things of a Psionic nature as Arcana might understand things of an arcane nature. It is a skill to help you identify Psionic objects, phenomena and creatures.

entries: A large orc is flung across the room, smashing through tables and chairs before hitting the wall in a thunderous crash, collapsing dazed. A human, her eyes glowing with unearthly power, tosses a few extra coins on the bar. "Sorry for the mess. If he wakes up, tell him to try picking on someone his own size next time."

The prisoner's expression turns from defiant to puzzled as the interrogator asks no questions, merely states at him silenetly. His puzzled expression turns worried as he finds himself, unbidden, recalling where he stashed the loot. "Under the stables behind the Rusty Hook Inn," the interrogator finally speaks, as the thief's expression becomes terrified.

"Ain't you... cold or somethin'?" the dwarf asks the elf as they trude through the snow, eying her simple robe and bare feet. "I just think 'warm'," the elf replies with a distracted air. The dwarf snorts, a puff of chilled air. Typical elf nonsense. Except... she hasn't frozen to death yet. "Say, could you think some 'warm' this way?" the dwarf asks hopefully. To the dwarf's surpsie, the chill of the snow fades away completely. "That's downright creepy... hey don't stop now! Was jus' saying it was creepy."

Psions are those who have tapped into a special otherworldly force, with the ability to actualize the power of their mind to accomplish impossible feats. Reading minds, lifting vast weights, and transcending physical limitations, they tend to inspire awe and terror in equal weight.

entries.name: Powerful Minds
entries: Since a psion's weapon is their mind, they are always a careless thought away from harming those around them. For a psion, the line between thinking and doing can be very thin, forcing them to keep their thoughts and emotions in check, least their powers run amok. This leads many of them developing odd behvaiors or mannerisms to help them control their state of mind, frequently seeming quite eccentric to an outside observer.

Consider how {@italic your} psion keeps their powers in check, and how much their power bleeds into their everyday life. How reading minds may affect their body language or habits. Do they add wood to the campfire from the comfort of their bedroll, or do they restrain themselves from using their power for trivial matters lest they slip up?

entries.name: Misunderstood Power
entries: In a world of widespread magic, many will assume a psion to be a type of sorcerer or wizard, mistaking their powers for the common applications of magic. The common villager keeps only one mental category for the supernatural people that bend reality to their will. But even among magic users, a psion's powers will frequently be found unnerving.

It is often those who {@italic do} understand magic that find a psion's abilities most aberrant. A force that intersects the magical weave rather than obeys it, the nature of the power that the psion wields one can only contemplate with unease.

fluff.name: Psion

entries.name: Creating a Psion
entries: When creating a psion, consider your character's background. How did you become a psion? Were you born with latent powers? Or did something happen to you granting your powers? Or did you intentionally train yourself through rigorous mental exercise to leverage them? Consider how developing a rare and mysterious power would have affected your interactions with people.

Consider what your purpose is with your new found powers, or how you plan to use your powers. Do you intend to be taken for a wizard casting magic, or are you freely open about being of a... different nature?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a psion quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Intelligence your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity or Constitution. Second, choose the {@background acolyte}, {@background hermit}, or {@background traveler} background.

entries.name: Some Terminology
entries: This class does get a little confusing with it's terminology, because the author insisted on prefixing everything with 'psionic'. Here's a miniature glossary, and some notes on understanding how Psion functions.

items.name: Psionic Archetype
entries: Psion subclass, basically.

items.name: Psionic Discipline
entries: Psionic Disciplines consist of one Psionic Power and a small list of spells. You can cast these spells with Psi points instead of spell slots.

You start with one Discipline (granted by subclass), gain a second discipline at 3rd level, and then you don't get a third one until 18th level. Choose carefully; disciplines heavily influence your Psion's playstyle.
An example of a Psionic Discipline is the {@optfeature Telekinesis Discipline}.

items.name: Psionic Power
entries: Psionc Powers are granted by disciplines. They are analogous to cantrips, but they are generally significantly more versatile than a spellcaster's cantrip would be- which is good, because you'll usually only have 2 of them for much of your adventuring career. You can think of them as your 'standard' combat option- if you're not casting a spell or activating some other ability, a Psionic Power is a good, reliable action to be taking.
Each Psionic Power has some modifiers that can be applied to them, listed in the Power's description.
See {@optfeature Telekinetic Force|PSN} for an example of a Psionic Power.

items.name: Psionic Mastery
entries: Psions recieve a feature  at 5th level called Psionic Mastery, granting a number of temporary psi points that can be spent near-exclusively on Psionic Powers. (Very rarely, other abilities will explicitly allow Psionic Mastery to be used on them.)

This is because {@i unlike} cantrips, Psionic Powers do not automatically get stronger as you gain levels. However, Psionic Mastery compensates for this- you can use Psionic Mastery's temporary psi points to boost your Power up to the effectiveness of a cantrip at the corresponding level (for example, your 1 temporary psi point at level 5 could be used on {@optfeature Telekinetic Force}'s Hammering modifier to make it do 2d10 damage, which is equal to a {@spell firebolt} at 5th level, {@i or} you could use it on other modifiers, sacrificing pure damage for versatility.
Essentially, you should be using Psionic Mastery every time you are using your Psionic Power, once it becomes available.
Note that Psionic Mastery can't be used on most Psionic Talents, or when casting spells.

items.name: Psionic Talents
entries: Psionic Talents are to Psions what Eldritch Invocations are to Warlocks. You get to pick new ones semi-frequently as you level up.
Each Psionic Discipline grants a number of discipline-exclusive talents you can choose from as well.
I didn't mean to kill him! He just made me angry, and I imagined shoving him.
Psions have within them a deep well of raw, untamed power. Their fight to contain and focus their power is unending. A simple distraction from their focus can have catastrophic consequences.

A psion's constant internal struggle can lead psions to developing odd quirks or habits that they have unintentionally developed to keep their powers under control. Adventuring psions often seek out opportunity to train and hone their powers without causing undue harm to the people around them. A psion that doesn't find ways to expend some of their power finds themselves like a powder keg ready to explode.
Playing a psion character is an opportunity to play an odd or unusual personality. To distinguish your psion character, consider the options in the sections that follow.

entries.name: Social Quirk
entries: What sort of quirk have you developed to prevent yourself from unintentionally harming others? How does this help you control your power?

entries.caption: Social Quirk
rows: Amused. You are quick to laugh, and find humor in circumstances that no one else finds funny. You are able to laugh off tense situations that might cause most people to snap.

Distant. Others might look over to you and see you staring off into the distance. You're not really looking at anything, but escaping inward, and getting mentally far away from the stimulus of the outside world.

Passionate. You have an unusual love that you will bring up frequently in conversation, and devote your spare time towards. It might be old copper coins, buttons, or jade figurines, but you find them far more fascinating than anyone else would.

Frightening. You enjoy startling and spooking others. You might start loudly barking like a dog right next to someone's ear, or briefly fly into a rage only to laugh it off a minute later. You tend to make anyone who doesn't know you uneasy.

Deluded. Your perception of reality differs from everyone else. Perhaps you think you are tree that has merely manifested itself as a elf as it became awakened, or maybe you think that all your friends are just psychic manifestations you have created.
Loving. You adore everyone you meet, and great them with big displays of affection. You act more like a puppy than anything else, and others can't help but be affected by your infectious joy.

entries.name: Origins
entries: Psionic powers are unsual and strange, side effects of the material plane interacting with the Far Realm.
Determine how your character gained their psionic powers, and think about how that origin would affect your character's backstory and growth.

entries.caption: Origins
rows: You were born with your powers, and no one knows why. No one else around you had any type of psionic power. Your powers were feared by your family, and you spent your childhood trying to keep your powers under control.
You somehow drifted into the Astral Plane while dreaming, and when you woke up, you had these new powers.
You studied and trained your mind until you were able to exert its power over the world around you. It was a long, difficult path but after many years your practice started paying off.
You are a part of a special group or race that naturally develops psionic powers as they grow up, so you had a lot of help developing your powers.
You encountered some being you shouldn't have, but your memory of it is distorted and vague. Your encounter gave you psionic powers but left you a little bit mad.
You travelled to a far off place where psionic power is not unusual. There you studied with psionic masters who trained you and helped you hone your psionic talents.

spell.name: Divide Self
entries: You you create an exact duplicate of yourself in an empty space you can see within 30 feet of you. When you cast this spell at the start of each of your turns for the duration, you can determine which of the duplicates is you.

It has all of your stats, abilities, and equipment (including magic items). It acts on your initiative, and has its own actions, though it shares its concentration on this spell, and if either of you lose concentration, the spell ends. Your current hit points are divided between you and the duplicate (you can divide them however you want) and shares all other resources and abilities with you (including limited use magic items), with any usage by either you or the duplicate depleting the resource for both of you.

Your duplicate can take any action you can take, but it can deal a maximum of 15 damage on its turn (any additional damage dealt deals no further damage, when dealing area of effect damage, damage is split between all targets equally up to the maximum).

If either you or the duplicate is reduced to zero, the spell ends and you become the copy that was not reduced to zero hit points. When the spell ends, if both you and the duplicate are still present, decide which is you, and the other vanishes. Anything that was copied during the spell has the copied version vanish.

*At Higher Levels:* When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the starting hit points of you and the duplicate both increase by 15 (but neither you or the duplicate can be given more maximum hit points) and the maximum damage the duplicate can do during its turn increases by 10 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mind Blast
entries: You emit a blast of psychic energy. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes 6d8 Psychic damage and is stunned until the end of their next turn on a failed save. A creature takes half as much damage and is not stunned on a successful save.

spell.name: Geas (Psionic)
entries: You place a magical command on a creature that you can see within range, forcing it to carry out some service or refrain from some action or course of activity as you decide. If the creature can understand you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While the creature is {@condition charmed} by you, it takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage each time it acts in a manner directly counter to your instructions, but no more than once each day. A creature that can't understand you is unaffected by the spell.
You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.
You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it.

spell.name: Compelled Query
entries: You focus your telepathic powers on a creature and ask it a question. It must make an Intelligence saving throw, or it conjures a short mental thought or image that answers your question to the best of its ability that you can perceive telepathically. If a character passes a saving throw against this ability, they have advantage on saving throws against it for next 24 hours.

spell.name: Delve Mind
entries: You delve into a creatures mind forcing it to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, for the duration or until you end the spell, you gain access to its memories from the past 12 hours, able to recall things it remembers as if they are you own memories, but these memories contain only things the target creature remembers.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can delve an additional 12 hours further back in the creatures memories for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flicker

time.unit: reaction, when you would take damage

entries: You flicker between the material and ethereal plane. Until the start of your next turn, each time you would take damage, including the triggering attack, roll a d4. On a 2, you gain resistance to that instance of damage. On a 4, you don't take any damage.

spell.name: Psychic Drain
entries: You draw on the psychic energy of another creature to sustain yourself. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure it takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and you gain temporary hit points equal to half the amount of psychic damage dealt and regain one expended psi point.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell deals an additional {@damage 1d8} psychic damage for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Unlocked Potential
entries: You unlock the potential of a creature's mind, allowing it to push past its limits. For the duration, once per turn the creature can add {@dice 1d4} to any attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw it makes. Each time it adds the additional {@dice 1d4}, it takes 1 psychic damage as it pushes beyond its natural limitations.

spell.name: Mutate
entries: You manipulate the nature of your body with magic temporarily giving it new properties. You immediately take {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage as your body forcibly morphs into a new form. You can select three of the following properties:

items: You grow one additional appendage. This appendage serves as an arm and a hand, though it can take the shape of an arm, tentacle, or similar appendage.
You extend the length of your limbs, increasing the reach on melee attacks, touch spells, and object interactions by 5 feet.
Your flesh hardens, your base AC becomes 14 + your dexterity modifier if it is not already higher.
You grow more resilient, adapting against one external threat. You gain advantage on one type of saving throw of your choice.
You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
Your body grows ablative armor. You gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of your turns.
You can grow one size larger or smaller.
You sprout wings. You gain a flying speed of 30 feet.

You grow a natural weapon; this weapon can have the statistics of any martial melee weapon without the thrown property, and takes on a form vaguely reminiscent of it. You have proficiency with this weapon, and are considered to be holding it. You can use your spellcasting modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with this natural weapon. The natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

entries: For the duration of the spell, you can use an action to change one or all of the properties, losing the benefits of your previously selected properties and gaining the benefits of the new selected properties.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher, you can select one additional property from the list of options, with one additional property per spell level above 3rd. The bludgeoning damage you take increases by 1d8 for each upcast level.

spell.name: Orbital Stones
entries: You lift three inanimate Small- or Medium-sized rocks or similar objects from within 10 feet of you, causing them to defy gravity and slowly circle you. With all three stones orbiting, you have three quarters cover. With at least one stone remaining, you have half cover.

As a bonus action while at least one stone remains in orbit, you can magically fling a stone at target within 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack roll. On hit, the target takes 3d10 bludgeoning damage and is knocked backward 5 feet.

spell.name: Spatial Manipulation
entries: You can swap the position two creatures you can see within 60 feet of yourself. An unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw, preventing the swap on success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can swap an additional set of creatures of each level about 5th.

spell.name: Future Insight
entries: Your roll {@dice 3d4} or {@dice 1d12} (your choice) and record the results. During the duration, you can expend one of these dice to add or subtract them from any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by a creature within 60 feet of you, until the dice are exhausted or the spell ends. You must expend the die after the roll is made, but before you know the outcome of the roll.
You can add only one die to a roll.

spell.name: Devouring Darkness
entries: Dark tendrils burst out from you in all directions. Creatures of your choice within must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they take 6d8 necrotic damage, and you can move them in a straight line to within 5 feet of you if there is an empty space they can be pulled to. On success, they take half as much damage and are not moved.
You regain hit points equal to one quarter (rounded down) of the necrotic damage taken by all targets effected by the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

feat.name: Psionic Mind
entries: You tap deeper into your psionic potential drawing out a new talent.

items: You can select a psionic talent from the psion class {@filter psionic talents|optionalfeatures|feature type=PSI:T} list. You cannot select a talent you already know or one that requires a level restriction, even if you are already of that level.

entries: You can take this feat multiple times, selecting a different talent each time.

feat.name: Inner Power

prerequisite.other: At least 1 psi or ki point

entries: Your body is powered by the inner powers that course through it. Your maximum psi or ki points (if you have both, your choice of which) increases by one.

At the end of your turn after expending one or more psi or ki points during your turn (not counting temporary or free points, such as those from Psionic Mastery), you heal for a number of hit points equal to the psi or ki points spent.

feat.name: Psionic Synthesis
entries: You gain the ability to meld your Psionic abilities together to produce potent new effects. When you select this feat, you can select one {@filter fusion talent|optionalfeatures|feature type=psi:ft} for free. You can only select fusion talents when you have all the Disciplines in their prerequisite.
You must take this feature again to gain another fusion talent.

monster.name: Psi Crystal
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Psi Familiar
entries: The psi crystal shares the same mental ability scores as its summoner.

optionalfeature.name: Animated Projections
entries: As an action, you can project a swarm of etheral objects. You can expend 5 psi points to cast {@spell animate objects} but it creates new etheral objects rather than animating existing ones.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Swap
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to swap places with your Astral Construct.

optionalfeature.name: Life Link
entries: When a solidified construct takes damage, you can choose to take that damage instead of the construct (no action required). You have resistance to the damage taken.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Weaponry
entries: When you project a weapon with your Project Item feature, it gains the following benefits:
You can project it as a bonus action and you can project up 3 weapons or pieces of ammunition at the same time.
You are proficient with any projected weapon.
It is no longer restricted to a maximum of 3 feet when it takes the form of a weapon (for a Medium-sized creature).
You can apply the Astral Construct modifiers Grow and Sustain to Projected Weaponry. Grow adds 1d8 to the weapon’s damage dice. You can expend Psionic Mastery on these modifiers.

optionalfeature.name: Unlimited Imagination
entries: When you manifest a construct, you can select two options from Boundless Imagination.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Sight
entries: You gain the ability to psionically see a creature's aura. As an action you can spend 1 psi point you can determine if a creature of your choice within 30 feet is under the influence of magic and what school it is, or if a creature is under the influence of psionics. A shape shifter or disguised creature makes a Charisma (Deception) check against your Psionics save, on failure you can see their true nature in their aura.

optionalfeature.name: Awaken Mind
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell awaken} without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Body Control
entries: You gain the ability to use your {@spell alter self} ability at-will without expending psi points. Additionally, you can cast {@spell enlarge/reduce} on yourself, you may expend 1 psi point instead of 2.

optionalfeature.name: Controlled Power
entries: You gain the ability to suppress the glow and somatic component of a psionic power. You can expend 2 psi points to use a power without a visual sign or somatic component. Each time you do this, the cost of doing so doubles until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Divided Mind
entries: You learn the {@spell divide self|PSN} spell, and can cast it by expending 5 psi points. You can cast it higher levels by expending a use of Innate Psionics to cast it once you gain the feature, casting it at the level of the level of the use of Innate Psionics expended to cast it. You do not require the material component of the spell even when casting it with Innate Psionics.

optionalfeature.name: Empathy
entries: You can psionically link yourself to other creatures. As a reaction to a creature taking psychic, necrotic, or radiant damage you can grant them resistance to the damage taken, but you take psychic damage equal to the damage they take (after resistance). The damage you take can’t be reduced or prevented in any way.
If the damage would inflict any further negative status effect on the target, you can choose for that effect to affect you instead.

If you have any form of telepathic bond that allows long- distance telepathic communication affecting the creature taking this damage, the range is unlimited and you do not need to be able to see them.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aegis
entries: As an action, you surround yourself with a swirling shield of fire, ice, or lightning. You gain temporary hit points equal to your psion level + your Intelligence modifier. Creatures that strike you while you have these temporary hit points take 1d4 damage of the shield type chosen.
Once you use this talent, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Emotions
entries: The powers you wield affect your state of mind, empowering you based on how you wield them. When you deal elemental damage, you gain the related mental property until the start of your next turn.

rows: You can add 1d4 to Wisdom saving throws.
You can add 1d4 to Constitution saving throws.
You can add 1d4 to Dexterity saving throws.

entries: If you are specialized in an element, you can instead add 1d6 to the related saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Shield
entries: You gain the ability to cast fire shield without expending psi points. Once you cast it this way, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 4 Psi Points to cast it again.

optionalfeature.name: Manifested Emotions
entries: You can manifest your emotions into elemental powers that take physical shape. While you are in an elemental emotion, you can expend 2 psi points to manifest that emotion into the world as a bonus action; this takes the form of a mephit ({@creature ice mephit} for cold, {@creature magma mephit} for fire, and {@creature spark mephit|MOD} for lightning).

As your emotion, given form, it acts immediately after your initiative at your directive. If not destroyed, it lasts for up to 1 minute, after which it naturally fades away. You can’t manifest more than one emotion at a time, and if it is destroyed, you take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage from the backlash.
This manifestation is not a sentient creature of its own, but simply a manifestation of your emotion.

entries.name: Emotional Actions
entries: There are no mechanical limitations on the actions of the manifested emotion, but it is recommended you consider the emotion from which it is manifest when determining its actions. Magma mephits will act rashly and aggressively, dust mephits will be restless and easily distracted, and ice mephits will be cold and calculating.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Regrowth
entries: You gain the {@spell cure wounds} for 1 psi point. You can cast it at a higher level by spending additional psi points. You can cast it a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, after which you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. When you cast {@spell cure wounds} on a creature, you can use Enhancing Surge on the target creature as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: The {@spell mutate|PSN} and {@spell polymorph|MOD} spells are added to your Enhancement Alternate Effects list.
You can only target yourself when casting polymorph this way.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Strike
entries: Once per turn, as part of making a weapon attack as part of the attack action, you can empower a melee weapon you are holding with psionic power. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can apply Elemental Blast or Telekinetic Force modifiers (you can only select a power you know) to the attack (you can use Psionic Mastery on this). This does not deal the base damage of the power, but any added damage causes the additional effects of the power damage effects to occur.

When applying a modifier that would make it target an area of effect, only the target takes the weapon damage, but other creatures in the radius become a target of the attack as if using the power normally.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Slam
entries: When you use the Telekinetic Force power, you can unleash it as a blast of kinetic power. You can use your power as a ranged spell attack (applying damage and effect on hit). You can only select the Hammering modifier when you use it in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Precise Power
entries: As a reaction to a ranged weapon attack you can see being made against a target within 60 feet of you, you can expend 1 psi point to add or subtract {@dice 2d4} to or from that attack roll. You can do this after the attack is rolled, but before you know the outcome of the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Matter Made Real
entries: You gain the ability to solidify some of your projections into real objects, you can cast {@spell fabricate} and {@spell wall of stone} expending psi points equal to the spell level.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Image
entries: You gain the ability to turn your {@optfeature Telepathy Discipline|PSN|telepathy} to project images into the minds of creatures with perfect clarity, interposing it over their reality. The spells {@spell silent image}, {@spell major image}, {@spell hallucinatory terrain}, and {@spell seeming} are added to your Telepathic Discipline alternate effects list (costing psi points equal to your spell level).

optionalfeature.name: Attuned Argument
entries: Your telepathic insight allows to adapt and tailor your influence on others. When you make a Charisma check, after you roll but before you know the outcome, you can choose to roll an additional {@dice d20} and take the higher result. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Influence
entries: You specialize in the subtle touch, picking stray thoughts and soothing concerns without overtly intruding upon a mind. You gain expertise in the Persuasion skill, though you are reduced to normal proficiency against creatures that are immune to mental influence or charm (such a creature under the effect of mind blank), .

optionalfeature.name: Reflected Agony
entries: When a creature within 120 feet that you can see deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to spend 1 or more psi points (up to your psi limit) to share the pain you experienced back at them, dealing 1d10 psychic damage per point spent. The damage this deals can’t exceed the damage taken from the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Opening
entries: Your Telepathic Communication gains an unlimited range as long as you have communicated with the creature within the last day, and the target willingly maintains the link. However, it takes an action to focus to communicate over distance if you can’t see the target (or for the target to communicate with you if they can’t see you). You can maintain a link with a number of people equal to your Intelligence modifier in this way. You can convey as much in a turn as you could by speaking normally.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Devourer
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell psychic drain|PSN} for 2 psi points. Additionally, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you that had an Intelligence score of 6 or higher dies, you can expend your reaction to draw in its psionic power, regaining 1d4 hit points and 1 expended psi point.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Rider
entries: As an action, you can touch a willing creature to see through its eyes and hear what it hears for the next hour, gaining the benefits of any Special Senses that the creature has.

During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own Senses. You can end this effect at any time. While this is active, the creature has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Focus
entries: You can enter a state of extreme focus. Your concentration is no longer interrupted by using a second ability that requires concentration, but your movement speed is reduced to zero while concentrating on more than one effect; you have a -5 penalty to any concentration check. If you move or fail a concentration check, one of your concentration affects ends. If you fail the concentration check by 5 or more, you lose concentration on both effects.
The stronger effect ends first, usually determined by spell level or psi points spent. If it is ambiguous which effect is stronger, the DM may decide which one ends, or can choose randomly.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Slash
entries: You can expend 1 psi point to make a single melee weapon attack against any targets you pass through with Phase Rift as part of the same action. You must spend 1 psi point per creature attacked this way. You can make this attack against a target once per turn. You can spend Psionic Mastery points on this talent.

optionalfeature.name: Rift Strike
entries: When you use your Phase Rift power as an action, you can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Shot
entries: When use your Phase Rift power, you can instead empower a piece of ammunition you touch, granting it the following special properties when you fire it:

items: It ignores half and 3/4th cover.
It deals {@damage 1d8} additional force damage.

entries: Additionally, applying Phase Rift modifiers grant special effects on this attack:

items.name: Disruptive
entries: The attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on hit.

items.name: Blurring
entries: You can roll an additional attack roll per psi point spent, selecting the highest roll.

items.name: Long
entries: The effective range of the attack is increased by 10 feet per point spent.

items.name: Echoing
entries: A second projectile is created on firing, using a separate attack roll. (You may target any creature in range with this attack, including the same creature)

items.name: Ethereal
entries: The attack can travel through up to 10 feet of cover.

optionalfeature.name: Flickering Escape
entries: Whenever you roll a d4 for flicker, you can teleport 5 feet after the attack resolves.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Shroud
entries: After using Phase Rift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + the psi points spent on the power. These temporary hit points last until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lingering Rifts
entries: When you use Phase Rift you can choose to leave a 5 foot wide tear in reality behind, forming a line between your starting location and ending location until the start of your next turn. Any creature that enters this area for the first time or ends their turn in it must make a saving throw against the effect of Phase Rift as if it passed through them. If a creature is in the area of multiple lingering rifts, they are affected only once.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Surge
entries: When you use Enhancing Surge targeting yourself, you can choose to make your Strength or Dexterity ability score equal to your Intelligence ability score until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Transcendent Life
entries: The {@spell mass cure wounds} and {@spell reincarnate spells} are added to your Enhancement Alternate Effects list. Reincarnate requires its normal material components when cast this way.
You can cast {@spell mass cure wounds} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, after which you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Psionics
entries: When a target passes the saving throw against a damaging Psionic Power (granted by a psionic discipline), they still take half the damage, but suffer no other effects.

optionalfeature.name: Psi Crystal
entries: You gain the ability to impart part of your mind into crystal. You can expend 2 psi points to cast the {@spell find familiar|MOD} spell, but your familiar takes on the statistics of a {@creature psi crystal|PSN} and the material component required is a crystal worth 10 gp instead of the normal material components.

The {@creature psi crystal|PSN} gains your mental stats. You can use Psionic Disciplines without a range of Self through your Psi Crystal is if you were standing in it's location. If the {@creature psi crystal|PSN} is destroyed, you gain its memories as your own. While you have a {@creature psi crystal|PSN} active, as a bonus action, you can decativate it to regain 2 expended psi points.
When you summon a psi crystal, you can store a fragment of your personality, that you can then release by shattering the crystal. Select one of the following when summoning a psi crystal:

items: {@b Courage}: When you make a saving throw against the Frieghtend condition, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal to gain advantage on the save.

{@b Cowardice}: When your Psi Crystal is within 30 feet of you and a creature comes within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal releasing that emotion and immediately move your movement speed away from the creature without taking an attack of opportunity.

{@b Cruelty}: When your Psi Crystal is within 30 feet of a creature that takes damage, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal releasing that emotion and causing the creature take additional damage equal to your Psion level.

{@b Sympathy}: When your Psi crystal is within 30 feet of you and another creature, if that creature takes damage, you can use your reaction shatter the crystal relasing that emotion and granting the creature resistance to that damage and take an equal amount of damage to the damage it takes.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Nightmares
entries: You gain an additional option for Boundless Imagination to apply to your Astral Construct: {@b Horrifying Nightmare}: Creatures that start their turn within 5 feet of your Astral Construct must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Psionics DC or become frightened of your Astral Construct until the start of their next turn.
Once they have saved against this, they are immune to the effect for the next 24 hours or until you summon a new Astral Construct.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Defenses
entries: You gain a way to defend yourself using your psionic powers. While you are not wearing any armor or carrying a shield, your Armor Class equals 11 + your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to imbue a weapon you are holding with psionic energy. For 1 minute, once per turn when you deal damage with that weapon, you can deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage.

At higher levels you can expend additional psi points to further enhance the Psionic weapon; 2 points to enhance it 2d6 at 5th level, 3 points to enhance it to 3d6 at 11th level, and 4 points to enhance it to 4d6 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Schism
entries: You can spend a psi point to temporarily subdivide your mind to do two things at once until the end of your turn. While are dividing your mind, if you use your action on a psionic power or spell granted by a psionic discipline, you can use your bonus action to use a psionic power. The two powers share your per use psi point limit between them.

optionalfeature.name: Surging Power
entries: When you target only yourself with Enhancing Surge, you can use the power as a bonus action instead of an action, but the damage and temporary hit points the base power grants are reduced to 1d4 when using the power this way.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Link
entries: Your telepathic communication gains an unlimited range as long as you have communicated with the creature within the last day, and the target willingly maintains the link. However, it takes an action to focus to communicate over distance if you cannot see the target (or for the target to communicate with you if they cannot see you). You can maintain a link with a number of people equal to your Intelligence modifier in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Movement
entries: You can expend a psi point to gain 10 additional feet of movement and the effect of {@spell spiderclimb}, {@spell feather fall}, or {@spell levitate} until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Weapons
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Telekinetic Weapons Psionic Power|PSN} as part of your Telekinesis Discipline (in addition to your other psionic powers), giving the ability to fling weapons as per the power.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Barrier
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Telekinetic Weapons Psionic Power|PSN} as part of your Telekinetic Discipline (in addition to your other psionic powers), giving the ability to fling weapons as per the power.

optionalfeature.name: Transcendent Focus
entries: You focus your telekinetic power, spreading it thin to create a large barrier. As an action you can expend 2 psi points to create a wall of weak telekinetic force 15 feet high and up to 40 feet long, or as a 15 radius around you. This barrier is visible as small objects hover and float within it. Ranged attacks that pass through this barrier are made with disadvantage as their trajectory is deflected. You can maintain this barrier by concentrating, as if concentrating on a spell, for up to 1 minute after creating it.
The barrier is immobile and does not impede movement.

optionalfeature.name: Visionary Sight
entries: You no longer need to see targets of Psionic powers, so long as they are within range and you know where they are. Being unable to see an attacker no longer grants them advantage against you, and you do not suffer disadvantage attacking unseen targets.

optionalfeature.name: Enhancement Discipline
entries: Enhancement is the ability to interact with a creature's nature and abilities with your psionic power.

entries.name: Enhancing Skill
entries: You can focus your psionics to enhance your abilities. Whenever you make a skill check using Strength or Dexterity, you can add 1d4 to the result.

entries.name: Enhancing Surge
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 round

You empower the body of a target creature you can see with your psionics. The target gains 1d6 temporary hit points and the next time the target deals damage, it deals 1d6 additional damage to one target of that damage roll. Any remaining temporary hit points from this power fade when you use it again.
You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Enhancing Surge (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.
{@bold Resilient} {@italic (3 psi points)} : The target gains resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn.
{@bold Fortifying} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : The target gains an additional +1d6 temporary hit points for each point spent.
{@bold Savage} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : The target's next weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each psi point spent.
{@bold Swift} {@italic (2 psi points)} : The target gains an additional action. That action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Enhancement psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:

rows: {@spell alter self}, {@spell darkvision|MOD}, {@spell enlarge/reduce}, {@spell lesser restoration}

entries: If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Projection Discipline
entries: Projection is the ability to project what is in your mind to the outside world with your psionic power.

entries.name: Project Item
entries: As an action, you can use your powers to project an inanimate object you imagine into your hands. It can’t be larger than 3 feet on any side or weigh more than 10 pounds, and is clearly ethereal in nature. The item behaves as a solid object. Weapons created with this feature deal force damage.
Projected items fade after 1 minute, and you can have no more than 3 projected items at a time.

entries.name: Astral Construct
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 60 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You project an ethereal creation from your mind taking the shape of a Medium or smaller creature, weapon, or other object. This creation is clearly ethereal in nature. When you create it, and on subsequent turns using your action to mentally control it, you can move it up to 30 feet in any direction and attack; so long as it does not move beyond the range of the power. To attack with it, make a melee spell attack, on a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

While the Astral Construct is active, you can spend Psi Points up to your per use limit to issue commands that effect and empower your construct. Commands require no action, but you cannot exceed your psi point limit in total commands issued, and each command can only be issued once per turn.

{@bold Grab} {@italic (1 psi point)} : [Construct must be Solidified] A target creature within 5 feet of your construct must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}; while grappled in this way, the target is {@condition restrained}. At the end of the creature's turns it can repeat the saving throw. The condition ends if the construct becomes ethereal again.

{@bold Grow} {@italic (1 psi points)} : Your construct increases by one size, and its number of damage dice increases by one. It returns to its normal size at the start of your next turn. It can only gain one additional die (for example, up to 2d8).
{@bold Relocate} {@italic (1 psi point)} : The construct teleports anywhere within 60 feet of you, though it cannot teleport through total cover.

{@bold Replicate} {@italic (3 psi points)} : You project a copy of your construct anywhere within 60 feet of you that you can see, which retains the effects of any Solidify or Grow command applied to the original. Until the end of your turn, you have two constructs and control both with the same action (commands only affect one of your choice). Pick one construct to fade at the end of your next, or use Sustain.

{@bold Solidify} {@italic (1 psi point)} : You construct becomes solid, blocking its space until the start of your next turn. You can only use this command if it is not in another creatures space. It has an armor class of 16, and hit points of your Intelligence modifier + your Psion level. The construct becomes ethereal again if it drops to zero hit points.
{@bold Strike} {@italic (2 psi points)} : The construct makes an attack (even if it has already attacked)

{@bold Sustain} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : At the start of your turn, you can sustain the effect of a Solidify, Grow or Replicate command for an additional round. An effect that has been replicated can be sustained across all replicated constructs with a single use, but each effect can only be sustained once per turn (for example, you can never sustain more than one replicated construct). This costs 1 psi point for each effect sustained. Sustaining Solidify refreshes the construct’s hit points to its maximum.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Projection psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend an additional psi point to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinesis Discipline
entries: Telekinesis is the ability to interact with physical objects and energy with your psionic powers.

entries.name: Telekinetic Hands
entries: When you gain this feature, you can manipulate small objects within 30 feet of you with your mind as if using your hand to interact with it. You can use this power to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contants out of a vial. You cannot attack, activate magical items, or carry more than 10 pounds in this manner. You can move an item you are controlling in this way up to 30 feet during your turn.
Simple object manipulations can be done as part of a free object interaction on a turn, but attempting anything complex will cost an action.
You can spend 1 psi point to increase how much you can lift by 100 pounds until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Telekinetic Force
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous

You smash a target creature or object you can see with your mental power. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 1d10 bludgeoning damage, and either be shoved 5 feet in a direction of your choosing or be knocked prone.

You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Telekinetic Force (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power, before any dice are rolled.
{@bold Crushing} {@italic (2 psi points)} : The target is restrained until the end of its next turn.
{@bold Hammering} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : The target takes +1d10 bludgeoning damage for each point spent.
{@bold Hurling} {@italic (1-3 psi points)} : The target is knocked +10 feet in a direction of your choosing for each psi point spent.
{@bold Sweeping} {@italic (1-3 psi points)} : You can target all creatures in a 5-foot radius of a point within range. The radius doubles for each point spent (5 feet, 10 feet, 20 feet).

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Telekinesis psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathy Discipline
entries: Telepathy is the ability to interact with the minds of other creatures using your psionic abilities.

entries.name: Telepathic Communication
entries: When you gain this feature, you can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don’t need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language. Creatures you communicate with telepathically automatically identify you as the speaker, adn they can reply in kind.

entries.name: Telepathic Intrusion
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous

You directly assault the mind of a creature you can see. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 psychic damage. If the target fails the saving throw, it has disadvantage on attacks made against you until the start of your next turn. You can choose to deal no damage to the creature when it fails its saving throw.

You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power, before any dice are rolled.

{@bold Meddling} {@italic (2 psi points)} : You make one creature invisible to target creature or cause the creature to see something that is not there with the effect of {@spell minor illusion|MOD} until the start of your next turn if it fails its saving throw.
{@bold Overwhelming} {@italic (2 psi points)} : The target is stunned until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw.
{@bold Rending} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : The target takes +1d8 psychic damage for each additional point spent.
{@bold Terrifying} {@italic (1 psi point)} : The target is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Telepathy psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Transposition Discipline
entries: Transposition is the ability to modify the properties of space and manipulate dimensional boundaries with your psionic powers.

entries.name: Flicker Steps
entries: On your turn, you can replace your movement by teleporting 5 feet in any direction to a space you can see. You can pass through creatures but can’t pass through objects, buildings or solid terrain. This distance increases by 5 feet at 5th level (to 10 feet), at 11th level (to 15 feet), and becomes equal to your walking speed at 17th level. This replaces all movement for your turn when used.
You can only use this feature when your movement speed is non-zero.

entries.name: Phase Rift
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 10 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 round

You step through space traveling up to 10 feet in a straight line, leaving a spacial tear behind. You can pass through creatures, but not objects, buildings, or terrain more than 4 inches thick. Any creature in the path of this tear must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage.
You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Phase Rift (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.

{@bold Blurring} {@italic (1-3 psi points)} : You gain an illusory duplicate, as per the mirror image spell. You gain 1 duplicate per psi point spent (up to a maximum of 3). One remaining image fades at the start of each of your turns.
{@bold Disruptive} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : Each target that fails their saving throw takes an additional 1d8 force damage.
{@bold Echoing} {@italic (2 psi points)} : You immediately Phase Rift again with the same action.

{@bold Ethereal} {@italic (2 psi points)} : You can pass through solid objects, buildings, and terrain as long as you end your Phase Rift in a space you can occupy. If your Phase Rift would end inside a space you can’t occupy, the power fails.
{@bold Long} {@italic (1-3 psi points)} : You can travel an additional 10 feet for each point spent.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Transposition psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Psychokinetics Discipline
entries: Psychokinetics is the mental art of spontaneously creating and controlling energy; sapping energy to freeze or spontaneously creating it create bursts of fire or arcs of lightning. Dangerous and destructive, it provides devestating power.

entries.name: Energy Manipulation
entries: When you gain this feature, you can manipulate energy in minor ways at will. As an action you can cause a light that casts 30 feet of bright light and 30 feet of dim light, cause things you touch to catch fire as if touched by a match, cause small arcs of electricity, freeze or thaw up to 5-foot cube of water. Any ongoing effect you create lasts 1 minute. You can have up your Intelligence modifier simultaneous effects, after which creating another ends the oldest ongoing effect.

entries.name: Elemental Blast
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 round

You can use your mind to create a burst of elemental power, blasting a target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 cold, fire, force or lightning damage.

For each die of cold damage dealt, the creature’s speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of their next turn. For each die of fire damage dealt by the original attack, the creature takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of its next turn. For each die of lightning damage dealt, an arc of lightning strikes another creature of your choice within 20 feet, dealing 1d4 lightning damage (multiple arcs may strike the same creature). Damage from these secondary effects doesn’t add any bonuses (such as Empowered Psionics).
You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.
{@bold Amplifed} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : The target takes an additional 1d8 cold, fire, force or lightning damage.

{@bold Lasting} {@italic (1 psi point)} : Your Elemental Blast leaves a 5 foot radius sphere of devestating behind where it strikes until the start of your next turn. Creatures that enter this zone for the first time or end their turn in it must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer the secondary effects (slow, burn, arc) of the blast as if they had been hit by it.

{@bold Massive} {@italic (1-3 psi points)} : You unleash a massive blast; rather than making an attack roll, all creatures within a 15 foot cone must make a Dexterity Saving throw. On failure, they take the effect as if hit by the Elemental Blast. The size of the cone is doubled for each point up to 3 spent (2 points for 30 feet, 3 points for 60 feet).

{@bold Overcharged} {@italic (0 psi point)} : You take {@damage 1d4} force damage and do not add your Proficiency modifier for the attack or Spell Save DC for your Elemental Blast, but increase the damage it deals by twice your Proficiency modifier.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Psychokinetics psionic discipline you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend an additional psi point to cast it at that higher level.

entries.name: Specializations
entries: When you take this Discipline, you may (but do not have to) select a specialization from the following list. You may only select a specialization at the time of gaining the Discipline, and cannot change or remove a Specialization once selected.

entries.name: Cryokinetic
entries: You can only deal cold damage with Elemental Blast. When a creature is hit by an attack of your Elemental Blast or fails a saving throw against this power, it becomes frozen until the end of its next turn, giving it disadvantage on its next attack roll or Dexterity saving throw, and reducing its speed by an additional 5 feet (to a total of 10 feet).
If the attack roll is a critical hit or the target rolls a natural 1 on their saving throw, the target becomes restrained while frozen.
When using your Psionics feature to cast a spell under Alternate Effects, the damage of the spell becomes cold damage.

entries.name: Electrokinetic
entries: You can only deal lightning damage with Elemental Blast, but the size of the damage dice of lightning damage (both the initial damage and arc damage) is increased by one step (to 1d10 initial damage and 1d10 additional damage per point spent on Amplified, and 1d6 arc damage to a nearby target per die of initial damage).
When using your Psionics feature to cast a spell under Alternate Effects, the damage of the spell becomes Lightning damage.

entries.name: Pyrokinetic
entries: You can only deal fire damage with Elemental Blast, but the size of the damage dice of fire damage (both the initial damage and burn damage) is increased by one step (to 1d10 initial damage and 1d10 additional damage per point spent on Amplified, and 1d6 burn damage at the start of their turn per die of initial damage).
When using your Psionics feature to cast a spell under Alternate Effects, the damage of the spell becomes Fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Precognition Discipline
entries: Precognition is the ability to see what lies ahead, piercing the veil of the future. Seeing things that most people cannot a Psion with Precognitive abilites can, to a limited extent, know the future; such a future is known by tracing its roots from the present, and grows more mysterious and cloudy as such roots grow distant.

Such a future can be changed by the actions of the present, particularly by knowledge of said future and action to prevent or change it. This is the function most often leveraged by Precognitive Psions, peering into the future to steer around courses they seek to prevent or steer toward a possible outcome they seek.

entries.name: Prescience
entries: Your eyes wander to events before they happen. Youa re proficient in Perception and Initiative

If you concentrate on keeping an eye on the future (as if concentrating on a spell), you can use your Intelligence modifier for Wisdom (Perception) checks (instead of Wisdom) and initiative rolls (instead of Dexterity). You can initiate this concentration by focusing for 1 minute.

entries.name: POWERNAME
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} Self
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous
You concentrate and peer into the stream of future possibilities, gaining insight into what will happen next; you can select one of the following:

items: You can grant advantage to yourself or to a creature that can see and hear you on their next attack roll made before the start of your next turn; if an attack that gained advantage from this feature hits, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.

You can grant disadvantage on the next attack roll against yourself or a creature that can see or hear you before the start of your next turn; if that attack hits despite the disadvantage, the damaged creature rolls {@damage 1d6} and subtracts that from the damage dealt.
You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Seeing (you can add multiple modifiers).

entries: {@bold Omniscient} {@italic (1 psi points)} : The beneficiary of your Seeing is under the effect of {@spell bless} and {@spell guidance|MOD} until the start of your next turn (effectively adding {@dice 1d4} to all attack rolls, ability checks, & saving throws).

{@bold Piercing} {@italic (1+ psi points)} :  You see through the target’s defenses when granting advantage, increasing the damage of the attack benefiting from advantage by 1d8 per psi point spent if it hits.
{@bold Positioning} {@italic (1+ psi points)} :  he beneficiary of your Seeing can immediately move 5 feet per psi point spent (up to their speed) without provoking opportunity attacks.
{@bold Thwarting} {@italic (2 psi points)} :  The beneficiary of your Seeing has advantage on the next saving throw they make before the start of your next turn.

{@bold Withheld} {@italic (0 psi points)} : Rather than granting advantage or disadvantage on the next attack, you can grant advantage or disavantage as a reaction to an attack being made until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the BLEGAHAL psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.
Spells cast via the Precognition discipline do not contact deities or other forces; rather, they represent the character's precognitive ability. This does not change anything mechanically.

optionalfeature.name: Nullification Discipline
entries: Nullification is the ability to interfere with the supernatural effects of the world, reverting reality back to its original state.

entries.name: Disruptive Touch
entries: When you gain this feature, you can create an aura of interference, wreathing yourself in the disruptive power that asserts reality. You can end minor magical or psionic effects (such as the result of cantrips or zero point psionic powers) by touching them, and have resistance to illusions or magical effects from objects you touch (gaining advantage on the saving throw against them, if applicable).

If you are grappling or otherwise touching a spellcasting or psionic creature, at the start of your turn you can expend 1 or more psi to interfere with their abilities until the start of your next turn. In order to cast a spell or use a psionic power, they must succeed on a saving throw of their spellcasting or psionic ability score against your psionics DC, unless they are casting a spell with a higher level or using a power with more psi points than the psi points spent on this feature.

entries.name: Denial
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous

You release a burst of raw psionic nullification at a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, it takes {@damage 1d4} force damage as its existence is disrupted.

If the target is an aberration, elemental, fey, fiend, or a creature with the ability to cast spells or use psionic powers, it takes an extra 1d4 force damage, and becomes disoriented; until the end of its next turn, it rolls a {@dice d4} and subtracts the number rolled from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as its Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. A creature can choose to fail the saving throw.

You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Denial, modifying its functionality (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power, before any dice are rolled.

{@bold Aura} {@italic (3 psi points)} :  Instead of targeting a creature, the power becomes an effect around you with a radius of 20 feet until the start of your next turn; any creature of your choice that enters or starts its turn in the area of effect must make a saving throw against the power.
{@bold Existential} {@italic (1+ psi points)} : You deal an additional 1d4 initial and bonus (if applicable) force damage to the target creature on a failed save.
{@bold Lingering} {@italic (1+ psi points)} :  You can apply the effect of Disruptive Touch to an affected creature.

{@bold Supernatural} {@italic (3+ psi points)} : You attempt to end the effects of a spell or a psionic power upon the target. The effect is only ended if the psi points spent on this modifier equals or exceeds the spell level or psi points spent on the effect. Additionally, if the effect has a duration of more than 1 minute, the cost of this ability is doubled; if the effect has a duration of more than 1 day, the cost is doubled again. If the effect lasts indefinitely, you cannot end it with this power.

You can also try to suppress the magical powers of other creatures. If the property is an innate property of a creature (either of the target creature, or affecting the target of this power), it is only ended if the psi points exceed the CR (or class levels) of the originating creature, and they return at the end of that creature’s next turn. The supernatural effect can’t be its existence, unless it has less than 10 hit points and it would otherwise qualify.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the BLEGAHAL psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Weapons Psionic Power
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous

You telekinetically fling a weapon at a creature or object. Choose a weapon within 15 feet that isn't being worn or carried, or choose a weapon under your control. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit the target takes damage equal to the weapon's damage dice. The range of the attack decreases to 15 feet if the weapon has the heavy or special property, and increases to 60 feet if the weapon has the light property.
You can use Psionic Mastery points on this power, and this power counts as a Discipline Power of the Telekinetics Discpline (for example, for the puporse of Empowered Psionics).
You can spend Psi Points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Telekinetic Force (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.
{@bold Multiple} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : For each additional psi point spent, you can fling an additional weapon.
{@bold Spinning} {@italic (2 psi points)} :You can replace an attack with casting {@spell cloud of daggers}

optionalfeature.name: Consumption Discipline
entries: Your psychic powers are those of a predator, and your prey is the minds of others. Their thoughts, their feelings, their vital psionic energies are your food

entries.name: Adaptive Hunter
entries: After using your Mind Leech on a target, you can gain one skill, tool or language proficiency that creature has until the end of your next long rest. If you use this ability again, you lose the last proficiency or language to acquire the new one. You cannot use Adaptive Hunter on the same target again for 24 hours.
The DM chooses the proficiency you gain, though they always select a proficiency you do not have, if possible.

entries.name: Mind Leech
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}

{@bold Casting Time:} 1 action
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Instantaneous

You assault the mind of a target you can see within range, rending and devouring its psionic energy. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition paralyzed}, the psychic damage becomes {@damage 1d12} instead. On a failed save, you gain a psionic charge of consumed power until the end of your next turn. You can expend this charge when you deal damage to deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, or consume this charge at the end of your turn to gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. You can spend only one charge at a time.
You can target the corpse of a recently perished creature with this power, as long as the target has died within the last minute and not been previously leeched by this power.

You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Mind Leech, modifying its functionality (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power, before any dice are rolled.
{@bold Devouring} {@italic (2 psi points)} : The range of Mind Leech becomes a radius of 5 feet, centered on you
{@bold Nourishing} {@italic (1 psi points)} : On a failed saving throw, you gain an additional psionic charge.

{@bold Rending} {@italic (1+ psi points)} :  The target takes an additional die of damage (1d6 or 1d12 as applicable if they are under the effect of a listed condition) per psi point spent on a failed save.
{@bold Shredding} {@italic (1 psi points)} :   You leave the target’s mind and soul shredded, reducing their next saving throw before the end of your next turn by {@dice 1d4}.

{@bold Stunning} {@italic (4 psi points)} : On a failed saving throw, the target becomes stunned until the start of your next turn. If the power affects multiple targets, select one target for this effect.

{@bold Thieving} {@italic (1 psi points)} : On a failed saving throw, you can draw a 5th level or lower spell the target can cast from its mind (from a Spellcasting or Psionics feature). You must be aware that it can cast that spell; the target retains the ability to cast the spell, but you gain the ability to cast the spell using your Psionics feature by spending psi points equal to the level of the spell (restricted by your psi point limit; you can’t use Psionic Mastery to cast this spell).

You can know one spell in this manner at a time, and retain the ability to cast the spell for 1 minute or until cast. If the spell is one that restores hit points, you reduce your own hit points by the amount healed by the spell.

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the BLEGAHAL psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at that higher level.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Arms
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to create psionic constructions serving as additional appendages. These arms last for 10 minutes. You determine the arms’ appearance, and they vanish early if you are incapacitated or die. You can use the astral arms to make unarmed strikes. The unarmed strikes you make with the arms use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. If you hit with one of them, you deal force damage equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

When you create them, or by spending 1 psi point as a bonus action while they are manifested, you can make a single unarmed strike with these arms as a bonus action. You can use Psionic Mastery points on this.

optionalfeature.name: Beam of Annihilation
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell beam of annihilation|PSN} for 6 psi points. If you have a specialization of Psychokinesis, you can only select the related elemental damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Controlled Power
entries: You gain the ability to suppress the glow and somatic component of your psionic powers. You can expend 2 psi points to use a power without a visual sign or somatic component. Each time you use this talent, the cost of doing so doubles until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dreamwalker
entries: You gain the ability to cast dream. You can cast the spell without expending a spell slot, but once cast, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Penetration
entries: When you use a psionic power or spell that deals cold, fire, or lightning damage, you can expend 1 psi point to make the power ignore resistance to that elemental damage damage type.
If you have a specialization of Psychokinesis, if the target has immunity to the damage type chosen, this can turns immunity into resistance for that power.

optionalfeature.name: Life Wielder
entries: You learn the spell {@spell life transference|MOD}.

optionalfeature.name: Personal Truth
entries: Your power of conviction allows you to believe what you choose to. If you spend at least one minute convincing yourself of something— no matter how absurd—spells and effects to determine if you are telling the truth will register that you believe what you have convinced yourself of.
Additionally, your psionic powers allow you to impose your will upon reality to a certain extent. When you expend 1 psi point, you can perform a minor alteration to reality:

As an action, you can conjure any Tiny object you can imagine that is worth 1 sp or less. This creates an object as you envision it, but doesn’t grant you knowledge you do not otherwise have (for example, you would be unable to conjure a key to a lock unless you had a perfect mental image of the correct key).
As an action, you can change the color or taste of a Small or smaller object with 10 feet. This change lasts for 1 minute.
As a reaction to a creature within 30 feet taking damage (including yourself), you can change the damage type they take.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Nightmares
entries: You gain an additional option for Boundless Imagination to apply to your Astral Construct:

items.name: Horrifying Nightmare
entries: Creatures of your choice that start their turn within 5 feet of your Astral Construct must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Psionics DC or become frightened of your Astral Construct until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, they are immune to the effect for the next 24 hours or until you summon a new Astral Construct.

optionalfeature.name: Tantrium
entries: Your anger boils just beneath the surface. When you roll initiative, you can instantly increase your rampage die by one step (from a d4 to a d6, for example). Additionally, if you take damage while your rampage die is a d6 or lower, your rampage die increases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Rift
entries: When using your Astral Swap ability (still costing 1 psi point), you can Phase Rift to where your Astral Construct is; this movement counts as a Phase Rift, and you can apply modifiers to it as normal. Your Astral Construct is moved to where you started this movement along the Phase Rift; during the movement you can use your action to command your Astral Construct to attack a creature it passes with its action.
This does not negate any other restrictions of phase rift. There may be situations where Astral Swap is possible but Astral Rift is not.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Phasing
entries: As you step between planes, you can tap into the Elemental Planes, bringing their power into the material with you. You can use Psychokinetic modifiers on Phase Rift (excluding Massive).
Additionally, whenever you deal damage to an area with a Psychokinetics ability that would include yourself, you can phase yourself out of reality to take no damage from the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Mastery
entries: Your ability to manipulate energy becomes a single blended prowess, freely swapping between manipulating force and energy. You can apply Telekinetic Force modifiers to Kinetic Blast and Elemental Blast modifiers to Telekinetic Force (though to do not gain any benefits from from a Specialization while doing so).

optionalfeature.name: Parasitic Nightmare
entries: You gain the ability to add Telepathic Intrusion modifiers to Mind Leech.

Additionally, when you deal psychic damage to a creature that is frightened of you, you can render yourself invisible to that creature until the start of your next turn; you can immediately (no action required) roll a Dexterity (Stealth) check affecting only creatures you are invisible from as a result of this talent.

If you are hidden from a creature that is frightened of you, when it moves, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature (at the completion of their movement).

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Blade Barrage
